Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Diploma in Services Management
headline: Learn how to create business services strategies that will deliver customer satisfaction with this free online course.
description: This free online Diploma in Services Management course will teach you how to design and develop service processes that improve customer experiences and increase service productivity and efficiency. Drawing customers to your business services takes specialist knowledge and skill, and this course will teach you the effective service strategy management skills necessary to meet customer needs and reduce operational costs.

courseDescription:
This course will first introduce you to Service Management and its core elements. You will look into the evolving service markets, service customers, and product service systems, and you will also be guided through the promotion of services. The course will then discuss the challenges of service management and the role of the consumer in the flow of services. You will also learn about the behavior of service consumers, the Co-creation of Services, and the Three-Stage Model of Service Consumption.

Next, you will study brand positioning. The course will teach you how to implement strategic planning and apply competitive strategies that are crucial for your company's success. You will study the different approaches to service pricing and learn about customer satisfaction and loyalty as well as how to develop loyalty bonds with customers. You will also look into the strategies that can help manage and develop customer loyalty and partner relationships in service management.

The business services sector is one of the most rapidly growing industries in the world, accounting for more than 60% of worldwide GDP. Gaining a better understanding of competitive service elements can help you create a loyal customer base that will secure your business goals. This course is designed to give you the skills you need to deliver truly excellent services that draw in and retain a great set of customers. So check out the course today, and start learning something really useful.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: What is Meant by Service Management?
modules.description: This module introduces the topic of service management and the elements of service management such as how best to serve customers in the modern business environment, what the product service systems are, what the service act comprises of, and how to ensure seamless service to customers both within and outside an organisation.
topics: What is Meant by Service Management? - Learning Outcomes
What is Meant by Service Management? - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Business services is a general term that describes work that supports a business but does not produce a tangible commodity. Business services are those that market offerings that are intangible-dominant. Few services are totally intangible, they often contain elements with tangible properties. The module also explains service dimensions: Intangibility, Heterogeneity, Inseparability and Perishability.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn how fluctuating demand from customers for a service can be addressed by managing capacity within the service process, and how businesses can use marketing elements to shape demand patterns for a service.
topics: Understanding the Challenges of Service - Learning Outcomes
The Role of the Consumer in the Services Flow
The Customer and Co-Creation of Services
Understanding The Challenges Of Service - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about The Three-Stage Model of Service Consumption and how this model allows service managers to set objectives and shape consumer behavior in a targeted manner. Also learn about self-service technologies (SSTs) and co-creation of business services and how these methods are the ultimate form of customer involvement in a business service when used appropriately.
topics: Current Service Map to New Service Design
The Role of Culture in Service Excellence
The Role of People in Service Excellence

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Service Management - First Assessment
topics: Diploma in Service Management - First Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn more about marketing strategies that help to position a business service within the market and create a reputable brand around the service.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn more about correctly pricing a business service within the market and the techniques and models used to formulate the correct market price.
topics: Strategy and Strategic Thinking for Services

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn improve service quality in business services for an enhanced service experience for customers.
topics: Quality in Service Management - Learning Outcomes
Quality in Service Management - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Managing Customer Loyalty and Partner Relationships in Service Management
modules.description: Learn more about strategies that help manage and develop customer loyalty and partner relationships in service management.
topics: Managing Customer Loyalty and Partner Relationships in Service Management - Learning Outcomes
Services as Systems: A Holistic Approach
Managing Customer Loyalty and Partner Relationships in Service Management - Lesson Summary

modules.details: Diploma in Services Management - Second Assessment
topics: Diploma in Services Management - Second Assessment

modules.name: Module
topics: Diploma in Services Management - Final Assessment

  • The main points from this module are:
  • What is Service?
    The action of serving, helping, benefiting …
    Acts, Deeds, Performances, Efforts … Different from Goods, Articles, Objects
    Usually no transfer of ownership

    Five broad categories within non-ownership framework of which two or more may be combined:
    • Contractual goods services.
    • Defined space and place rentals.
    • Labor expertise contracts.
    • Access to shared physical environments.
    • Access to and usage of systems and networks.


    Value creation is dominated by intangible elements.

  • The main points from this module are:
  • Variations in demand relative to capacity:
    Demand > Capacity => Business is lost
    Demand > Optimum capacity => Quality declines
    Excess capacity => Wasted resources
    Optimum capacity => Demand = Supply
    Low utilization => May send bad signals

    Productive capacity services take several forms in services:
    • Time 
    • People
    • Space

    Two basic approaches of which most firms use:
    • Adjust level of capacity to meet demand
    • Manage level of demand
